Pre-Game Insights: Mali have been one of the most improved sides in Africa over the last two years and are tipped to win this group, which will grant them entry to the World Cup for the first time in their history.

The Eagles delivered an impressive performance at the Africa Cup of Nations earlier this year, topping their group with five points, including a victory over South Africa and holding Tunisia to a 1-1 draw, allowing them to advance from the group stage.
Mali knocked Burkina Faso out of the tournament in the round of 16 and took the lead against Ivory Coast in the quarter-finals before the hosts managed to equalize and eventually win in extra time.
Mali are unbeaten on home soil since March 2022, while they have only lost once since March 2023.
Ghana have not won an away match in their last 11, dating back to September 2022, when they overcame Nicaragua.
Mali have won their last two home matches against Ghana, scoring three goals in each game.
